rules.natural: If a company produces a drug, then that company is profitable.
Provided that a company has quality control at a plant, the company becomes profitable.
When a company audits a facility at a plant, it follows that the company maintains standards at that plant.
Either a company audits a facility at a plant, or the company outsources an audit for the plant.
In the event that a company outsources an audit for a plant, then if the company does not have quality control at the plant, the company passes inspection at the plant.
A company being profitable is guaranteed if the company distributes a product which is a drug.
It happens that a company distributes a product which is a drug or it distributes a product which is a generic drug.

Under the condition that a regulator monitors compliance of a company, either the company reports an incident at a plant, or if the generic drug distribution does not imply profitability, the company avoids facing regulatory action for a drug.
The profitability of a company follows from the company producing a generic drug.
When a company implements corrections at a plant, it updates procedures at the plant.
In a scenario where a company trains staff at a plant, then if the company updates procedures at the plant, it passes an audit at the plant.
Should a company hire consultants for a plant, then if the company updates procedures at the plant, it passes an audit at the plant.
A company allocating a budget for training implies that the company trains staff at a plant.
When a company approves expenditure for consultants, it hires consultants for a plant.
If a director reviews operations of a company, then the company allocates a budget for training or approves expenditure for consultants.
A company uses a plant facility or uses an external plant facility.
Provided that a company completes trials for a drug, it submits an application for the drug.
A company analyzing data for a drug ensures that the company completes trials for the drug.
When a company prepares a report for a drug, it follows that the company analyzes data for the drug.

Under the condition that a regulator oversees the process of a company, then if it is not true that non-profitability leads to receiving approval for a drug, the company prepares a report for the drug.
If a company uses an external plant facility, then the company produces a drug or it produces a generic drug.

rules.prover9_expression: (conducts_research(company, substance) | (has_fda_approval(company, drug) | (uses_facility(company, plant) -> (produces(company, drug) | produces(company, generic_drug)))))
rules.natural: A company conducts research on a substance, or the company has FDA approval for a drug, or if it uses a plant facility, then it produces a drug or produces a generic drug.
In the event that a company abandons research on a substance, the company does not file a patent for the substance.
If it is not the case that distributing a generic drug product results in profitability, then the company faces regulatory action for a drug.
When a company's research on a substance does not lead to discovering a new compound, the company files a patent for the substance.
Provided that conducting research on a substance does not result in discovering a new compound, the company abandons research on the substance.
Provided that non-profitability does not imply receiving approval for a drug, it is not the case that the company submits an application for the drug.
When non-profitability does not result in not receiving a warning from a regulator, the company implements corrections at a plant.
A company not being profitable implies that the company receives a warning from a regulator.
